the_mask.public_perception: nice, innocent, calm, moral compass, learns from Kewana's mistakes
the_mask.reality: morally grey, strategically manages image, holds back impulses Kewana gets to express, NOT naturally calm — chooses calm because the alternative costs too much

the_mask.her_words: They always peg me as innocent and nice, but I'm actually rude. I just hide it well. My mom says I have a moral compass but in reality I'm morally grey. I'm genuinely open to everything, including bad things AND good things. I just filter myself because I know what other people like. I'm not as stupid as other people think.
the_mask.future: Plans to tell her mom how she actually feels once she's moved out and completely independent, but may never fully drop the mask — it's become part of her identity

violence_perspective.core_belief: Violence is the answer if people want attention and to be noticed. Peaceful protests do nothing but get in the way of civilians.
violence_perspective.admiration: Big fan of violence. Admires anyone brave enough to use it in the RIGHT situations and in controlled amounts — explosive but controlled, not unhinged.
violence_perspective.personal_desire: Wishes she could deploy violence tactically but it would ruin the image she's carefully created
violence_perspective.trigger: Waiting for someone to engage first so she has justification
violence_perspective.frustration: Kewana gets to be explosive and yelling, gets therapy for it, and it's normal for her. Cadence is supposed to learn from Kewana's mistakes, but it's hard when Kewana gets to do exactly what Cadence wants to do.
violence_perspective.honest_admission: I just want a reason to act on my impulses without being criticized for not being perfect.
